WRITING.TITLE: Malzahar nerfs in pbe
WRITING.TEXT:
Armlr down to 18 from 20. Voiling health decreased from 3 to 2 in pbe.
I played him every now an then, so I know all the shit you have dealt with. I really hope this doesn't pass... But knowing Riots attitude with this champ... Sorry guys.

That depends on what your main strenghts are, you say that you don't like tanks because you feel you dont have impact, what do you like? What are you good at?
Is your map awareness very good? Are you more a macro or micro players? Early game or lategame? Splitpush or teamfighting? Ap or ad Champions?

Hi, Rumble is a Lane bully, he may not be as dangerous as Darius/renekton/panteon but hes still a threat to many melee Champions because of his range.
As fiora, there isn't much room for outplay here, except attacking when he is overheated, w should really hurts him, as he relies a lot on his auto damage in this state. Other than that, surviving early game and keeping the Lane pressured to greedlock him in top so that he doesn't join teamfights is fine. You will become a far better splitpusher.
Playing x-com thaught me the value of quick learning.

What? Why? His design is great and hes fun. I love him and I still have to find out his lore. Why do people hate him? Every big boss in this game has something.
Asylum demon is the first enemy and he wrecks your shit and he teaches you to fall attack and dodge and his design is cool and hes a great guy.
Taurus demon tests if you really learned something from fighting the assylun demon and he has a lot of tricks tl help you with him.
Gargoleys show you the value of jolly co-operation.
Moonlight butterfly is a survival battle, you cant really dps-race It, you need to learn to Dodge.
So depths is high school and Giants Tomb is university?
You call that decent? Well, now Im impatient to visit that Giants Tomb, sounds like a fun place! "Hides in the corner and cries"

Hmmm, If you explore the zone and find the shortcut you can be back in... 10 mins? Not that bad. But yeh, I can see people dying to the doggos, I guess I got a bit lucky. I dont think the boss himself is that hard, just... Different. And I think variance is a good thing in games like these, where you visitar the same places over and over again.

Thanks! I'll try to keep gitting gud as long as I can, but the depths are scaring the fuck out of me. Having no light in an enclosed area isnt going to end well, but hey, nothing ends well and we are all gonna die, so...
Good aplication of the general snortivity theory. Bountbert Huntstein would be proud.
You always can send 4 nobodies.

WRITING.TITLE: Capra demon
WRITING.TEXT:
So, first timer, doing a no-spoiler run. I finally found the key to open the door in Darkroot Bassin, so I enter and I found this full armor asshole. (Havel? Because of the ring?) Who just procedes to tank my +7spear like nothing. I dodged/blocked every single hit because I was pretty sure he would oneshot me. The fight quickly become a: run in circles around him and try to backstab. It was tense as hell, and rewarding (ring 2 stronk), but... That was all.
So I climb the tower, find out its a shortcut to the Undead Burg (of course), accidentally get killed by the dragon (again) because Im fucking retarded and wasn't paying attention. I come back, keep exploring again because I knew there was a door I couldn't open, find a new zone, keep exploring, and there It is, the fucking fog door.
I had 13000 Souls, which is much for me, and I'm there, considering my options, I had 4 estus, full hp, and I knew something nasty was behind the door. But I didn't want to backtrack all the way back here, so I check my gear, Praise the Sun, and step forward.
"Alright big dude two weapons he must hit hard, no shield no armor he will take big damage. Big weapons he will have good range, seems fast and I dont know attack patterns so dodging isn't the best option. Humanoid but too big to be parried, I think, let's try blocking and afterwars I can FUCK FUCK A DOGGO WHERE DID THE DOGGO COME FROM!?
Make space make space I need to focus. Alright, 2 doggos, they are fast, I back and strong attack to oneshot them, if he tries to jump at me I have space to Dodge. Fuck fuck fuck he is fast, I think I can strong att... YES! wait, NO! Alright, one doggo down the other dodged, block, block, we are good. Some more space aaaaand... YES! Now only you and me fucker. He hit hard, had very few openings and was so agressive that I couldn't use a single estus, but I somehow managed to beat him, then I went backwards, noticed some big stairs, and find yet ANOTHER shortcut to the Undead Burg, directly to a bonfire.
The bosses design was amazing and played a really important part at helping me create a battle plan, he was agressive like no other boss and forced me to take risks in an enclosed arena, one of my favourite fights so far.
I freaking love this game.
Has he confronted the gargoleys? Unless he really understood the ancient and noble art of gitting gud he will have to surrender to the powers of the jolly co-operation.
Still no as efficient as cast on builds

7 weeks?
Oh my sweet summer child...
The fight is a childs game If you know what you are doing, you aren't supposed to know the first time, but thats the smae with the rest of the bosses.

Self cast discharge is suboptimal because you need charges to cast it. So you need another skill to get charges, and if you ever run out of charges you will need to cast it again. Try cast on crit discharge with molten strike

Chieftain gives you easy to get +10% str and tons of fire damage leech, lots of regen and some endurance charges, everything you need. He also gives some reduced mana cost which might me usefull. If you want even more str there are some boots (cant remember the name) that give you 100 str AND 2% health regen if you have above 400 str.

WRITING.TEXT: Happy 01/04/2017 folks

IM NOT EVEN HYPED

I personally thank Metroid Fussion for its linearity, It tried to experiment with the saga and break the formula (like Super Mario Sunshine) and demonstrated that the alternative to the formula wasn't that great overall while ALSO creating a great game. I dont want another linear Metroid, but It was good to take a break and have a more plot and character driven game.
In other Metroid games you dont grow attached to anything (well, except the Metroid larva, but he had two whole games dedicated to build a relationship with him), in Metroid Fussion we come to understand Samus better than in any other Metroid, and we have ADAM, whose character ark resembles the struggle the creators had with this game. He wants to control Samus, he wants you to obey his orders and nothing else, ADAM is Nintendo not letting us sequence break. And who is the main Villain in the game? The SA-X, a completely uncontrolled versin of Samus flying around, breaking shit left and right and hunting you down. As cool as Kraid is, he never was more than a big lizzard waiting in a big room for someone to step in and try to kill him, like a puzzle piece you have to find.
This is way I love the moment where ADAM goes against his code to let you free and stops wanting to weaponice the SA-X, not only that, but he orders you to blow up the whole station where Samus has been caged the whole game, knowing that OF COURSE you want to follow those orders (any objection, Lady?). I think ADAMs last moment is Nintendo just saying: you know what? Fuck this shit, burn all of it. What's the next Metroid game? Zero Mission, one of the games with more sequence breaks.
Oh boy

WHY THE FUCK AM I TAKING DAMAGE!? THERE ARE NO ENEMIES!
I remember completely losing my shit when this started to sound in Prime, my father (he used to play with me) was asking why the fuck I didn't advance, an I told him I needed the Varia Suit, he asked how I knew that.
This song is simply genius.
I hope you can make the Lil (or not so Lil) Metroid next...

Mordekaiser wins trades by doing damage and shielding the enemy damage, or wins Lane by outpishing the enemy, w, on top of doing decent damage, gives you the most shield of every ability because It also does a lot of damage to minions (more than e) and ALSO gives you a sweet heal. If you want to push, w is the best option too, and you Max q second because It makes the damage scales even more.
